banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: How to benefit from uncomfortable conversations
videoData.socialTitle: How to benefit from uncomfortable conversations

nodes.description: Director of Sustainability, Sloan School of Management, MIT
nodes.whoTheyAre: Jason Jay is a Senior Lecturer at the MIT Sloan School of Management and Director of the Sustainability Initiative at MIT Sloan. His research focuses on how people navigate the tensions between personal, business, and social goals in sustainability efforts. His first book is Breaking Through Gridlock: The Power of Conversation in a Polarized World and he has published articles in the Academy of Management Journal and California Management Review. He teaches courses on strategy, innovation, and leadership for sustainable business at MIT, and engages students and alumni in hands-on projects with leading companies and organizations. Prior to MIT, Jason was a management consultant for Dialogos International, where he consulted on leadership development and organizational change for major international corporations and NGO's including BP and the World Bank. Jason holds a Ph.D. in Organization Studies from the MIT Sloan School of Management, and an AB and M.Ed from Harvard University.

videoData.description: Facilitator Jason Jay dissects how conversations sour, offering ways to move past the discomfort and even harness the creative energy of disagreement.
videoData.socialDescription: Facilitator Jason Jay dissects how conversations sour, offering ways to move past the discomfort and even harness the creative energy of disagreement.
